cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 225 mi (365 km) southwest of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move north across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, make landfall along the Florida Panhandle, then sweep northeast across the Southeast U.S. and Mid-Atlantic toward the Atlantic Ocean

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings only for parts of western Cuba and eastern Yucatán Peninsula
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf Coast, Southeast U.S., Mid-Atlantic (including MD/DE/VA) and portions of the Northeast coast
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible (30–40 mph) as Michael’s remnants pass nearby late Thu–Fri
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge <3 ft possible in upper Chesapeake Bay if on-shore flow develops
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible with locally higher amounts if the track passes directly over the region
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out in outer rain bands across the Mid-Atlantic
